head.supplied: 21st July [186]9 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the 22nd May last, ¶ stating that you have no seeds of the blue Gum or blackwood trees available for distribu...

div.p: 360/69, unit 15, p. 629, VPRS 431, outward registered correspondence, Engineer in Chief, VA 2877, Department of Railways, Public Record Off, Victoria.

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the 22nd May last,
See M to T. Higinbotham, 22 May 1869 (in this edition as 69-05-22a). stating that you have no seeds of the blue Gum or blackwood trees available for distribution, but that you will be glad to supply some miscellaneous young plants of trees, if provided with sketches of the ground prepared and protected.

In reply, I beg to say that it has not been found possible to prepare any plan of the proposed plantations; but that if you can supply the Department with 120 or 130 young plants of shrubs of any description for planting where some received from the Botanic Gardens last year, have failed I shall feel obliged.
